subject: Self Care
title: EQ in Parenting
description: A 60-second lesson on EQ in Parenting.

hook.text: A child throws a tantrum. 'Stop crying!' shuts them down. 'You seem frustrated' opens them up. Worlds apart.

buildup.text: Emotion coaching is the practice of helping children name, understand, and regulate their feelings with you.

discovery.text: Gottman found that emotion-coached children have better focus, health, academic performance, and social skills.

twist.text: You can't coach emotions you haven't mastered yourself. A parent's EQ directly shapes their child's EQ.

climax.text: When your child is upset: validate the feeling, set the limit on behavior. 'You can be angry but you can't hit.'

punchline.text: Validate feelings. Limit behavior. That's EQ parenting.

quiz.question: What is emotion coaching in parenting?
options: Helping children name, understand, and regulate their feelings
